This section is for comments only.description: Design considerations - this snippet is not intended to be executed
body: These Snippets are intended to make life easier for Ampersand authors.
We use the convention to start names of placeholders with an illegal character,
so that it will be colored red while it has not been replaced with user text.

Define a Concepts population.description: Define a POPULATION of Concept Atoms

Define a Relation population.description: Define a POPULATION of Relation pairs/links

Define a context.description: Define a CONTEXT, and its PURPOSE. You need to add the ENDCONTEXT statement yourself
Define a context.comment: this snippet ensures that you do not forget to document the PURPOSE of a CONTEXT that you define

Define a concept.description: Define a CONCEPT and optionally, a reference
Define a concept.comment: this snippet ensures that you do not forget about the optional reference text

ExecEngine rule.description: Define a RULE that the ExecEngine will maintain (including the VIOLATION statement)
body: VIOLATION (TXT "{EX} ${4|InsPair,DelPair,InsAtom,DelAtom|};${5:Relname};${6:srcConcept};", SRC I[$6], TXT ";${7:tgtConcept};", TGT I[$7])

Equivalence rule.description: Define a relation whose population is maintained to be the same as that of an expression
body: VIOLATION (TXT "{EX} InsPair;$1;$2;", SRC I[$2], TXT ";$3;", TGT I[$3])
VIOLATION (TXT "{EX} DelPair;$1;$2;", SRC I[$2], TXT ";$3;", TGT I[$3])
